intro: Papaver bornmuelleri, commonly known as the Bornmueller's poppy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its striking red or orange petals and a distinctive, elongated seed capsule. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known species like the opium poppy. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
